question: Where does the food come from?
answer: Our produce is donated by several local organisations like SecondBite. These groups collect excess or imperfect food that would otherwise go to waste. To ensure meals are nutritionally balanced, we purchase protein from local markets.

question: What types of meals do you make?
answer: We make wholesome, balanced hot meals based on what we receive from donors. Common meals include stews, curries, soups, and stir-fries. We take feedback from recipients to ensure meals are enjoyable.

question: Are the meals nutritious?
answer: Yes! Nutritious, plant-based hot meals are our specialty. OBK works with top Australian nutritionists to ensure every meal is wholesome and delicious.

question: How many meals do you give out per year?
answer: In 2021, OBK staff and volunteers cooked and distributed over 250,000 meals across New South Wales.

question: Where do the meals go?
answer: We provide meals to many charities such as Adra Community Centre, Asylum Seekers Centre, Bear Cottage, Cancer Council, Mission Australia, St Vincent's Health, Wayside Chapel, Vinnies CEO Sleepout, and many more. Anyone in need can walk in — no questions asked.

question: Do you see a growing demand for meal requests?
answer: Yes, OBK sees an increase in demand every single year.

question: How does OBK differ from other food charities?
answer: OBK focuses on connection and empowerment. We bring people together, turn recipients into givers, and create a community through cooking and giving.

question: Does OBK operate nationally?
answer: Currently OBK has one kitchen in Bondi, NSW, but aims to expand across Australia.

question: Can anyone come in?
answer: Yes! Everyone is always welcome. OBK considers the kitchen the community's home.

question: How do I volunteer?
answer: All volunteers must register online using the OBK sign-up form here: https://www.obk.org.au/volunteer. Volunteers over 18 must have a valid Working With Children Check (WWCC). You can learn more about WWCC here: https://www.service.nsw.gov.au/transaction/apply-for-a-working-with-children-check. Please note that OBK does not accept walk-in volunteers. Registration, following the outlined steps, and adhering to the dress code are mandatory to help keep OBK safe and organised.

question: How can I help?
answer: You can help by booking an event, volunteering your time, or donating equipment, services, or funds.

question: Are you partners with any other charities?
answer: Yes. OBK partners with many charities and contributors. You can view all partners here: https://www.obk.org.au/our-contributors

question: Charities you support
answer: OBK supports charities such as ASC, Cancer Council, Gift of Life, Montefiore, Ted Noffs Foundation, Stand Up, Sydney Children’s Hospitals Network, Vinnies CEO Sleepout, and many others.

question: Can I donate food?
answer: Yes, but regulations and kosher requirements mean not all food can be accepted. OBK is happy to inspect donated produce.

question: If I need food, how do I get it?
answer: Call (02) 8084 2729 and OBK will help.

question: Where is OBK located?
answer: 36 Flood Street, Bondi NSW 2026, Sydney, Australia.

question: How can I contact OBK?
answer: Phone: (02) 8084 2729 | Website: https://www.obk.org.au

question: What do you do at Our Big Kitchen?
answer: OBK is a community run, non-denominational, industrial kitchen where meals are prepared for distribution to needy people across Sydney.

question: What programs do you have?
answer: OBK offers Corporate Team Building Events, School Programs, Private Events and Parties, and Kitchen Hire.

question: Is there a cost per program?
answer: Yes, kindly check our website - Cook for a Cause: https://www.obk.org.au/group-events

question: What do you do at The Big Kitchen?
answer: OBK runs corporate and community volunteering sessions where groups help prepare, cook, and pack meals for people in need.

question: What kind of kitchen do you have?
answer: OBK is an industrial kitchen that is fully certified—Kosher, HACCP, and Halal.

question: What are your session times?
answer: Morning Session: 9:00 AM - 12:00 PM. Afternoon Session: 12:30 PM - 3:00 PM.

question: Do you have closed days?
answer: OBK is closed on Saturdays in observance of Shabbat Day.

question: How many people can we bring?
answer: OBK can accommodate up to 60 participants, provided no other groups are booked in the same session. Minimum group size is 8 people.

question: What should we wear?
answer: Closed-toe shoes, comfortable clothing, no loose jewelry, and long pants.

question: Do we need to bring anything?
answer: No. All equipment, ingredients, and safety gear are provided.

question: Is there parking available?
answer: Yes, limited onsite parking is available, along with nearby street parking.

question: When is the payment due?
answer: Payment should be completed before the due date on your invoice.

question: What payment methods do you accept?
answer: OBK accepts bank transfers and credit card payments via a payment link.

question: Can we change our group size?
answer: Yes, but please provide the final count at least one week before your event.

question: Can we cancel or reschedule?
answer: Yes, but OBK appreciates as much advance notice as possible.

question: Do you offer refunds?
answer: No refunds are issued. OBK provides a credit note valid for 12 months.

question: Will food be provided for volunteers?
answer: No, but refreshments are available. Optional lunch add-on: $30 + GST per person. Food platters are also available.

question: Can children participate?
answer: Yes, children 5+ may join with a supervising parent/guardian or via school/OOSH programs.

question: Do you have accessibility options?
answer: Yes, the kitchen and workstations are accessible. Please inform OBK of any specific needs.

question: How do we make a donation?
answer: You can donate via the OBK website: https://www.obk.org.au/corporate-team-building?form=FUNQUSKFNBE or send a bank transfer and email info@obk.org.au.

question: Can we take photos?
answer: Yes! Please avoid photographing other groups or staff without permission. Tag OBK on social media.

question: Who do we contact for questions?
answer: Email info@obk.org.au or call (02) 8084 2729.

question: What is Our Big Kitchen?
answer: OBK is a community-run, kosher-certified industrial kitchen in Bondi that prepares and distributes meals to people in need.

question: What do volunteers do?
answer: Volunteers help with food preparation, packaging, cleaning, organizing, leading group activities, and general kitchen support.

question: Do I need cooking experience?
answer: No. All skill levels are welcome, and OBK staff will guide you.

question: What should I wear to volunteer?
answer: Closed-toe shoes only, no activewear, no sleeveless shirts. Caps, head coverings, and aprons will be provided.

question: Is there a minimum age to volunteer?
answer: Yes. Individual volunteers must be 18+. Ages 15+ may volunteer with a parent. Exceptions apply for Duke of Ed and school community service programs.

question: Are there requirements to volunteer?
answer: Yes. Volunteers aged 18+ must have a valid Working With Children Check (WWCC).

question: How long are volunteer shifts?
answer: Shifts are 2-3 hours. Morning: 8:30 AM-12 PM. Midday: 12 PM-3 PM. Afternoon: 3 PM -5 PM (Tue-Fri).

question: How do I book a volunteer shift?
answer: Email volunteers@obk.org.au to check availability and book your session.

question: How do I register as a volunteer?
answer: Use the online link: https://obk.my.site.com/volunteer-sign-up.

question: Is there a cost to volunteer?
answer: No. Volunteering is free. Volunteers aged 18+ must have a valid WWCC.

question: How do I track volunteer hours?
answer: Hours are tracked through the OBK volunteer portal. WWCC holders are automatically added.

question: Can I volunteer with a friend or family member?
answer: Yes. A valid WWCC is recommended for anyone 18+. Contact volunteers@obk.org.au.

question: Does OBK accept Duke of Ed volunteers?
answer: Yes! OBK supports students participating in the Duke of Edinburgh program.

question: What tasks do Duke of Ed volunteers do?
answer: They help with meal preparation, dishwashing, cleaning, packing meals, watering plants, and organizing the kitchen.

question: What is the Duke of Ed volunteer schedule?
answer: Monday to Thursday, 3:30 PM-4:30 PM. Contact volunteers@obk.org.au for exceptions.

question: Will OBK sign my Duke of Ed record book?
answer: Yes, OBK will sign and verify your hours.

question: How do I schedule my Duke of Ed hours?
answer: Email volunteers@obk.org.au with your availability. Weekly shifts are recommended.

question: Book a teambuilding event or make an equipment donation?
answer: To book a teambuilding event or discuss equipment donations, please contact us here: https://www.obk.org.au/contact-us

question: How do I volunteer or sign in as a volunteer?
answer: To volunteer with OBK, please sign in or register here: https://www.obk.org.au/volunteer

question: How can I contribute through a cash donation?
answer: You can contribute through a cash donation using this link: https://www.obk.org.au/donate?form=FUNQUSKFNBE

question: How can I bring my school to OBK?
answer: School registrations and program details are available here: https://www.obk.org.au/school-programs

question: Can I host a one-of-a-kind party at OBK?
answer: Yes, OBK offers private parties and functions. Learn more here: https://www.obk.org.au/private-functions

question: What if my idea or question is not on the list?
answer: If your thoughts are not listed, please contact us here: https://www.obk.org.au/contact-us

question: Do you have cookies?
answer: We prepare cookies specifically for first responders and charity groups. We do not have cookies readily available for general consumption.

question: How can I use OBK's commercial kitchen for my business?
answer: OBK offers a commercial kitchen facility to help power up your budding business. You can learn more about kitchen hire and catering options here: https://www.obk.org.au/kitchen-hire-and-catering
